references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of large language models (LLMs), demonstrating their capability of few-shot learning, a key concept behind the current LLM agents research.
This work provides a comprehensive overview of deep learning, the foundational technology underlying LLMs, crucial for understanding the theoretical basis of LLM agent development.

This paper presents a thorough evaluation framework for LLMs, addressing the limitations of existing benchmarks and providing valuable insights into evaluating the capabilities of LLMs, essential for the development of effective LLM agents.

references.paper_title: Webgpt: Browser-assisted question-answering with human feedback
references.reason: This work introduces WebGPT, a pioneering example of an LLM agent that utilizes external tools (web browser) to improve its performance, showcasing the potential of tool usage in augmenting LLM capabilities which is a key aspect explored in AGILE.

references.paper_title: React: Synergizing reasoning and acting in language models
references.reason: This paper introduces ReAct, a framework that combines reasoning and acting within LLMs, providing a foundation for the development of more sophisticated LLM agents capable of handling complex tasks, directly informing the design of AGILE.
